intro: Mascagnia anderssonii, commonly known as the Andes mescal bean, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain toxic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
